author: m.kalinin
content:
I have submitted a proposal for a fork choice test format extension that would allow implementing optimistic sync tests as a part of consensus-spec-tests suite. https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-spec-tests/issues/28

Once we agreed on the format we can outline test case scenarios that are worth implementing in our opinion. CL client devs input would be very much appreciated.

author: ralexstokes
content: <@425572898787426305> have you thought about using kurtosis if hive doesn't support this use case readily -- i think we have been using it for tests that look kind of like this

author: ralexstokes
content: i'm necessarily opposed but i'm not sure the consensus spec tests are the right place for this kind of test given their static nature and i imagine we want a more dynamic execution environment for sync tests generally

author: tersec
content: My general inclination is to separate out tests which require an EL. It's a qualitatively distinct thing to set up and can't really be run in isolation. Additional failure modes, etc.

author: tersec
content: The CL spec tests are useful partly because they're these purely algorithmic, 100% deterministic things.

author: ralexstokes
content: i do see more "integration" down the line, e.g. testing withdrawals, where we would likely want to mock out some EL state

author: tersec
content: If that PR gets accepted, that's what I'd probably do anyway. Have enough experience with flaky tests in other situations that I'm not going to do that with these CL spec tests.

author: potuz
content: these tests should be optional, and the EL response can be completely mocked making them 100% deterministic

author: potuz
content: I'm happy that you relented <@425572898787426305> and decided to do this instead of relying solely on Hive
